title: Calculating the novel Glucose Color Index (GCI) metric for continuous glucose monitoring data
text: package calculating Glucose Color Index (GCI) using continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) data sufficient continuous wear. metric aims complement existing CGM variability metrics capturing “color”, shape variation summarization periodogram - decomposition variation periodic signals across fundamental frequencies. GCI metric derived validated using CGM diabetes comorbidity data Hyperglycemic profiles Obstructive Sleep Apnea (HYPNOS) Atherosclerosis Risk Communities (ARIC) studies. paper publishing metric, along validation procedures results, can found “journal”. package aims simplify automate calculation novel metric, providing process logical periodogram calculation parameter defaults well requisite weights final GCI calculation (derived HYPNOS study population).

title: Calculating the novel Glucose Color Index (GCI) metric for continuous glucose monitoring data
text: pgram(): Calculate log-normalized smoothed periodogram estimate log spectral density provided CGM time series (values temporal argument provided separately) linear_approx(): Summarize CGM log-periodogram using disjoint linear models 3 disjoint frequency bands (corresponding periodicities longer day, day 2.5 hours, shorter 2.5 hours) calculate_GCI(): Calculate GCI using either results linear_approx() raw CGM time series long-format contained within dataframe default_pgram(): Function provide defaults calculation CGM log-periodogram (trimming, filtering, smoothing, etc.) used derivation/validation GCI

title: Calculating the novel Glucose Color Index (GCI) metric for continuous glucose monitoring data
